definition: strange/unusual/evil ways/dishonest practices
demonic/iniquitous/nefarious/evil/unhealthy influences that cause disease (Chinese medicine)/(coll.) strange/abnormal

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men
lit. devil's gate, crooked path (idiom); corrupt practices/crooked methods/dishonesty

sentences.english: Can you see what's weird about it?
sentences.chinese: 你能看出它哪裏邪門嗎？

sentences.english: I wonder whether the so-called master under the Eighth Ground is a true Buddhist practitioner or a preacher of evil sects?
sentences.chinese: 八地以下的師傅是正信的三寶還是邪門歪道？

sentences.english: Exsanguination , as long as my blood wasn't being used for something awful.
sentences.chinese: 因放血而死，只要我的血沒被用在邪門歪道上。

sentences.english: "What unorthodox effort is what you used exactly?"Gu way long Fen Fen however say.
sentences.chinese: “你用的到底是什麼邪門功夫？”賈道長忿忿然說道。

sentences.english: That stuff is just so fast, so amazing.
That stuff is too fast and too odd.
He said he was afraid Larry'd gone bad and wouldn't come back any more.
sentences.chinese: 他說他擔心拉里已經走上邪門歪道，不會再回來了。

sentences.english: But just the same, now that business is out of the way, why do you want to do it?
sentences.chinese: 但是一樣，那樁生意很邪門，爲啥你要那樣做？

definition: clumsy/all thumbs
to have no sense of shame
at a loss/unable to do anything about it/to have no choice
erhua variant of 哥們|哥们[ge1 men5]
"sensational headline writers", people who write misleading titles in order to generate clicks from Internet users/clickbait
to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to have good luck/lucky/in luck
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
perfectionist
brazen
(usu used in the negative) to be of importance or to matter/to be in the way/to be a hindrance
hard to say/unpleasant to say/can't be sure
to be an irksome presence (i.e. sth or sb one wishes were not there)
to talk drivel/to assert sth without a proper understanding or basis in fact/not to know what one is talking about
to attract people's affection/charming/delightful
